text: Hector Borla (May 6, 1937 - January 11, 2002) he was an Argentinean painter and illustrator. Born in Esperanza, Santa Fe, Argentina, he obtained notoriety with his series of oil paintings devoted to Butterflies, Postal-stamps, Henry VIII Wiveshttp://www.artnet.com/Galleries/Artists_detail.asp?gid=69&aid;=2803 and exhibited in Buenos Aires, London, Dallas, México and Miami. He died in Buenos Aires, Argentina.
